docs.snippet: As expected, the Soviet Union and Cuba are going to restore the diplomatic relations broken in 1952. No one can question Cuba's right to do so. Mexico, Uruguay and Argentina have long had relations with Russia. As was recognized at the American...
docs.lead_paragraph: As expected, the Soviet Union and Cuba are going to restore the diplomatic relations broken in 1952. No one can question Cuba's right to do so. Mexico, Uruguay and Argentina have long had relations with Russia. As was recognized at the American Assembly's Caribbean meeting in March, "it would be fruitless to seek to prevent official or private relationships between Latin-American and Communist nations, and the United States public must recognize this fact."

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 13 -- Finance Minister, Juan E. Azzini survived a parliamentary debate today on the reform, of the currency. The program, which took effect at the beginning of the year, has jolted Uruguay's economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 13 -- Finance Minister, Juan E. Azzini survived a parliamentary debate today on the reform, of the currency. The program, which took effect at the beginning of the year, has jolted Uruguay's economy.
docs.abstract: Min Azzini survives Opposition attacks on stabilization program, Cong debate; efforts to fight inflation discussed

headline.main: URUGUAY UPHOLDS MONEY REFORMS; Finance Minister Survives Congress Attack -- Sours Stringency Measures

docs.snippet: GENEVA, May 14 -- The United States is expected to make a major policy statement on the newly formed European Free Trade Association at the session of the member nations of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade beginning here Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, May 14 -- The United States is expected to make a major policy statement on the newly formed European Free Trade Association at the session of the member nations of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade beginning here Monday.

docs.snippet: Week Ended May 13, 1960 The continued weakness in the Canadian dollar was the focal point of interest in foreign exchange trading in the past week. British pound sterling had a fairly steady undertone in moderately active dealings.
